nodes.bodyText: This should be used only for testing locally. When you publish the PR, you should put in app/build.gradle implementation 'com.github.royosef:NewPipeExtractor:48b397567813a8b78a21d47e830e879b49e7036c' //your last newpipe extractor commit.
Why does this have an extra space before it?
Why does this have an extra space before it?
Why is this checking whether a subchannel exists, but then the parent uploader url is used?

We open the sub-channel when it exists on click. On long-click we want to open the parent channel, but only if it has a sub-channel, as you could just click when it doesn't have a sub-channel to open the parent channel.

Shouldn't you also hide subChannelThumb? just to be sure that it is gone, because I think it could happen (i.e. when restoring instance) that handleResult is called twice and with different results, thus possibly resulting in wrongly showing the thumbnail left behind from the previous call. Not sure though if this is really an issue, but this is already the implemented behaviour with uploaderThumb
I didn't do that, as it's gone by default in the .xml, so I thought that's not needed.

Mmmh ok, it not the best to have hardcoded default values for things that could possibly be used multiple times, but maybe we can ignore it since if we were to make videodetailfragment reusable it would mean changing many things, so I guess this is just not important
I didn't do that, as it's gone by default in the .xml, so I thought that's not needed.
why is this a warning? Apart from that, this info should only be put in the log in debug apks
